'Keith Richards' (born 18 December 1943) is an English musician, singer and
songwriter who is a founder member of the English rock band the Rolling Stones.
[[Rolling Stone]] magazine said Richards had created on guitar, "rock's greatest
single body of riffs", and ranked him fourth on its 100 best guitarists list.
Fourteen songs Richards wrote with the Rolling Stones' lead vocalist Mick Jagger
are listed among Rolling Stone magazine's "500 Greatest Songs of All
Time". Richards' notoriety for
illicit drug use stems in part from several drug busts during the late 1960s and
1970s and his candour about using heroin and other substances.
categories: British rhythm and blues boom musicians
